lead_paragraph: Doesn't it seem that Christmas décor arrives earlier and earlier every year? Now that Halloween has passed, we suspect that some people are already placing little drummer boys and nutcrackers on their front lawns, stringing up lights on their porches and decking their halls with candles (and with menorahs, too). Bryant Park is getting dressed for the occasion. We even saw a faux tree in a store in SoHo the other day. We need you, our readers, to send us dispatches from your neighborhood, your street, your house, of these early yuletide sightings.
snippet: Call for submission: Are your neighbors getting ready for the holidays already? Send us photos of the first decorations of the season.

headline.main: Send Us Your First Yuletide Sightings in New York

abstract: Call for submission: Are your neighbors getting ready for the holidays already? Send us photos of the first decorations of the season.
